hints.title: Exponential Convergence from LSI
hints.content:
362: :label: thm-exp-convergence-hybrid
363: 
364: If a discrete-time Markov chain satisfies a Log-Sobolev inequality with constant $C_{\text{LSI}}$, then:
365: 
366: $$
367: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \pi) \leq e^{-t/C_{\text{LSI}}} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_0 \| \pi) + C_{\text{asymptotic}}
368: $$
369: 
370: where:
371: $$
372: C_{\text{asymptotic}} := \frac{C_{\text{total}}}{\tau(\alpha_{\text{kin}} + \beta_{\text{clone}})}
373: $$
374: 
375: **Proof**: This is the standard Bakry-Émery argument. Iterating the contraction inequality from Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-composition-reference`:
376: 
377: $$
378: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_{t+1} \| \pi) \leq (1 - \epsilon) D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \pi) + C_{\text{total}}
379: $$
380: 
381: gives the geometric series:
382: $$
383: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \pi) \leq (1 - \epsilon)^t D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_0 \| \pi) + C_{\text{total}} \sum_{k=0}^{t-1} (1 - \epsilon)^k
384: $$
